La función realiza la conversión opuesta a lo que hace bufferpos-to-filepos . Los argumentos opcionales quality y coding-system tienen el mismo significado y valores que para bufferpos-to-filepos .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer position of the next beginning or end of an overlay, after pos. If there is none, it returns (point-max).
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición del búfer del siguiente principio o final de una superposición, después de pos . Si no hay ninguno, devuelve (point-max) .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer position of the previous beginning or end of an overlay, before pos. If there is none, it returns (point-min).
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición del búfer del principio o final anterior de una superposición, antes de pos . Si no hay ninguno, devuelve (point-min) .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer shown in window at the last time window change functions were run for window’s frame. If it returns nil, window has been created after that. If it returns t, window was not shown at that time but has been restored from a previously saved window configuration afterwards. Otherwise, the return value is the buffer shown by window at that time.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el búfer que se muestra en la window la última vez que se ejecutaron las funciones de cambio de window para el marco de la ventana . Si devuelve nil , la window se ha creado después de eso. Si devuelve t , la window no se mostró en ese momento, pero luego se ha restaurado desde una configuración de ventana previamente guardada. De lo contrario, el valor de retorno es el búfer que muestra la window en ese momento.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer specified by buffer-or-name. If buffer-or-name is a string and there is no buffer with that name, the value is nil. If buffer-or-name is a buffer, it is returned as given; that is not very useful, so the argument is usually a name. For example:
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el búfer especificado por buffer-or-name . Si buffer-or-name es una cadena y no hay búfer con ese nombre, el valor es nil . Si buffer-or-name es un búfer, se devuelve como se indica; eso no es muy útil, por lo que el argumento suele ser un nombre. Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer that marker points into, or nil if it points nowhere.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el búfer al que apunta el marker , o nil si no apunta a ninguna parte.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer that overlay belongs to. It returns nil if overlay has been deleted.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el búfer al que pertenece la overlay . Devuelve nil si se ha eliminado la overlay .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer that window is displaying. If window is omitted or nil it defaults to the selected window. If window is an internal window, this function returns nil.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el búfer que muestra la window . Si la window se omite o es nil se establece de forma predeterminada en la ventana seleccionada. Si window es una ventana interna, esta función devuelve nil .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer visiting file filename. If there is no such buffer, it returns nil. The argument filename, which must be a string, is expanded (see File Name Expansion), then compared against the visited file names of all live buffers. Note that the buffer’s buffer-file-name must match the expansion of filename exactly. This function will not recognize other names for the same file.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el filename archivo del archivo visitante del búfer . Si no existe tal búfer, devuelve nil . El argumento filename , que debe ser una cadena, se expande (consulte Expansión de nombre de archivo ) y luego se compara con los nombres de archivo visitados de todos los búferes en vivo. Tenga en cuenta que el buffer-file-name del búfer debe coincidir exactamente con la expansión del filename de archivo . Esta función no reconocerá otros nombres para el mismo archivo.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the buffer-local binding of variable (a symbol) in buffer buffer. If variable does not have a buffer-local binding in buffer buffer, it returns the default value (see Default Value) of variable instead.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el enlace local del búfer de la variable (un símbolo) en el búfer del buffer . Si variable no tiene una asociación local al búfer en el tampón de buffer , se devuelve el valor por defecto (véase el valor por defecto ) de variable en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the byte at character position <var>pos</var> in the current buffer. If the current buffer is unibyte, this is literally the byte at that position. If the buffer is multibyte, byte values of
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el byte en la posición del carácter <var>pos</var> en el búfer actual. Si el búfer actual es unibyte, este es literalmente el byte en esa posición. Si el búfer es multibyte, los valores de bytes de

trans-unit.source: This function returns the category set for character char in the current buffer’s category table. This is the bool-vector which records which categories the character char belongs to. The function char-category-set does not allocate storage, because it returns the same bool-vector that exists in the category table.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el conjunto de categorías para el carácter char en la tabla de categorías del búfer actual. Este es el vector bool que registra a qué categorías pertenece el carácter char . La función char-category-set no asigna almacenamiento, porque devuelve el mismo vector bool que existe en la tabla de categorías.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character following point in the current buffer. This is similar to (char-after (point)). However, if point is at the end of the buffer, then following-char returns 0.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter que sigue al punto en el búfer actual. Esto es similar a (char-after (point)) . Sin embargo, si el punto está al final del búfer, following-char devuelve 0.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character in the current buffer at (i.e., immediately after) position position. If position is out of range for this purpose, either before the beginning of the buffer, or at or beyond the end, then the value is nil. The default for position is point.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter en el búfer en en la posición (es decir, inmediatamente después de) position . Si la position está fuera del rango para este propósito, ya sea antes del comienzo del búfer o en el final o más allá, el valor es nil . La position predeterminada es el punto.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character in the current buffer immediately before position position. If position is out of range for this purpose, either at or before the beginning of the buffer, or beyond the end, then the value is nil. The default for position is point.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter en el búfer actual inmediatamente antes de la posición de la position . Si la position está fuera del rango para este propósito, ya sea al comienzo o antes del búfer, o más allá del final, entonces el valor es nil . La position predeterminada es el punto.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character of glyph code <var>glyph</var>.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter del glifo de código de <var>glyph</var> .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character preceding point in the current buffer. See above, under following-char, for an example. If point is at the beginning of the buffer, preceding-char returns 0.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter que precede al punto en el búfer actual. Vea arriba, en following-char , para ver un ejemplo. Si el punto está al principio del búfer, preceding-char devuelve 0.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character whose Unicode name is string. If ignore-case is non-nil, case is ignored in string. This function returns nil if string does not name a character.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el carácter cuyo nombre Unicode es string . Si ignore-case no es nil , case se ignora en la string . Esta función devuelve nil si la string no nombra un carácter.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the charset of highest priority containing the character at position pos in the current buffer. If pos is omitted or nil, it defaults to the current value of point. If pos is out of range, the value is nil.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el juego de caracteres de mayor prioridad que contiene el carácter en la posición pos en el búfer actual. Si pos se omite o es nil , toma el valor actual del punto por defecto. Si pos está fuera de rango, el valor es nil .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the code point assigned to the character char in charset. If charset doesn’t have a codepoint for char, the value is nil.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el punto de código asignado al carácter char en el charset de caracteres . Si charset no tiene un punto de código para char , el valor es nil .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the coding system that is in use for encoding terminal output from terminal. A value of no-conversion means no encoding is done. If terminal is a frame, it means that frame’s terminal; if it is nil, that means the currently selected frame’s terminal.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el sistema de codificación que se utiliza para codificar la salida del terminal desde el terminal . Un valor de no-conversion significa que no se realiza ninguna codificación. Si el terminal es un marco, significa el terminal de ese marco; si es nil , significa el terminal del marco seleccionado actualmente.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the coding system to use (by default) for performing <var>operation</var> with <var>arguments</var>. The value has this form:
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el sistema de codificación que se utilizará (por defecto) para realizar <var>operation</var> con <var>arguments</var> . El valor tiene esta forma:

trans-unit.source: This function returns the coding system used for decoding keyboard input from terminal. A value of no-conversion means no decoding is done. If terminal is omitted or nil, it means the selected frame’s terminal. See Multiple Terminals.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el sistema de codificación utilizado para decodificar la entrada del teclado desde el terminal . Un valor de no-conversion significa que no se realiza ninguna decodificación. Si se omite el terminal o es nil , significa el terminal del marco seleccionado. Consulte Múltiples terminales .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the combination limit for <var>window</var>.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el límite de combinación para la <var>window</var> .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the command that was executed to start process. This is a list of strings, the first string being the program executed and the rest of the strings being the arguments that were given to the program. For a network, serial, or pipe connection, this is either nil, which means the process is running or t (process is stopped).
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el comando que se ejecutó para iniciar el process . Esta es una lista de cadenas, la primera cadena es el programa ejecutado y el resto de las cadenas son los argumentos que se le dieron al programa. Para una conexión de red, en serie o de tubería, esto es nil , lo que significa que el proceso se está ejecutando o t (el proceso está detenido).

trans-unit.source: This function returns the contents of extra slot <var>n</var> (zero based) of <var>char-table</var>. The number of extra slots in a char-table is determined by its subtype.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el contenido del espacio extra <var>n</var> (basado en cero) de <var>char-table</var> . El número de ranuras adicionales en una tabla de caracteres está determinado por su subtipo.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the contents of the entire accessible portion of the current buffer, as a string.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el contenido de toda la porción accesible del buffer actual,como una cadena.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the contents of the field specified by <var>pos</var>, as a string, discarding text properties.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el contenido del campo especificado por <var>pos</var> , como una cadena, descartando las propiedades del texto.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the contents of the field specified by <var>pos</var>, as a string.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el contenido del campo especificado por <var>pos</var> , como una cadena.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the contents of the register reg, or nil if it has no contents.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el contenido del registro reg , o nil si no tiene contenido.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current 1-minute, 5-minute, and 15-minute system load averages, in a list. The load average indicates the number of processes trying to run on the system.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve los promedios actuales de carga del sistema de 1,5 y 15 minutos,en una lista.El promedio de carga indica el número de procesos que intentan ejecutarse en el sistema.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer’s case table.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la tabla de casos del búfer actual.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer’s category table.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la tabla de categorías del búfer actual.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer’s local keymap, or nil if it has none. In the following example, the keymap for the
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el mapa de teclas local del búfer actual, o nil si no tiene ninguno. En el siguiente ejemplo, el mapa de teclas del

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer’s mark position as an integer, or nil if no mark has ever been set in this buffer.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición de la marca del búfer actual como un número entero, o nil si nunca se ha establecido ninguna marca en este búfer.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer’s recorded last file modification time, as a Lisp timestamp (see Time of Day).
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la última hora de modificación de archivo registrada en el búfer actual, como una marca de tiempo Lisp (consulte Hora del día ).

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current buffer.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el buffer actual.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current depth of activations of the minibuffer, a nonnegative integer. If no minibuffers are active, it returns zero.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la profundidad actual de las activaciones del minibúfer,un entero no negativo.Si no hay minibúferes activos,devuelve cero.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current depth of recursive edits. When no recursive edit is active, it returns 0.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la profundidad actual de las ediciones recursivas.Cuando no hay ninguna edición recursiva activa,devuelve 0.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current display-width of the minibuffer prompt, if a minibuffer is current. Otherwise, it returns zero.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el ancho de pantalla actual del indicador de minibúfer,si un minibúfer es actual.En caso contrario,devuelve cero.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current gap position in the current buffer.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición actual de la brecha en la memoria intermedia actual.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current gap size of the current buffer.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el tamaño de la brecha actual del buffer actual.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current global keymap. This is the same as the value of global-map unless you change one or the other. The return value is a reference, not a copy; if you use define-key or other functions on it you will alter global bindings.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el mapa de teclas global actual. Este es el mismo que el valor de global-map a menos que cambie uno u otro. El valor de retorno es una referencia, no una copia; si usa define-key u otras funciones en él, alterará los enlaces globales.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current mode for reading keyboard input. It returns a list, corresponding to the arguments of set-input-mode, of the form (interrupt flow meta quit) in which:
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve el modo actual para leer la entrada del teclado. Devuelve una lista, correspondiente a los argumentos de set-input-mode , de la forma (interrupt flow meta quit) en la que:

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current position of point in <var>window</var>. For a nonselected window, this is the value point would have (in that window’s buffer) if that window were selected. The default for <var>window</var> is the selected window.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición actual del punto en la <var>window</var> . Para una ventana no seleccionada, este es el valor que tendría el punto (en el búfer de esa ventana) si esa ventana estuviera seleccionada. El valor predeterminado de la <var>window</var> es la ventana seleccionada.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current position of the end of the minibuffer prompt, if a minibuffer is current. Otherwise, it returns the minimum valid buffer position.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la posición actual del extremo del indicador del minibúfer,si un minibúfer es actual.En caso contrario,devuelve la posición mínima válida del búfer.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current setting of xwidgets query-on-exit flag, either t or nil.
trans-unit.target: Esta función devuelve la configuración actual del xwidget consulta al salir de xwidget , ya sea t o nil .

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current syntax table, which is the table for the current buffer.

This function returns the current time and date as a human-readable string. The format does not vary for the initial part of the string, which contains the day of week, month, day of month, and time of day in that order: the number of characters used for these fields is always the same, although (unless you require English weekday or month abbreviations regardless of locale) it is typically more convenient to use format-time-string than to extract fields from the output of current-time-string, as the year might not have exactly four digits, and additional information may some day be added at the end.

This function returns the current time as a Lisp timestamp. Although the timestamp takes the form (high low micro pico) in the current Emacs release, this is planned to change in a future Emacs version. You can use the time-convert function to convert a timestamp to some other form. See Time Conversion.
This function returns the current time as a floating-point number of seconds since the epoch. The optional argument <var>time</var>, if given, specifies a time to convert instead of the current time.

This function returns the current vertical scroll position of window. The default for window is the selected window. If pixels-p is non-nil, the return value is measured in pixels, rather than in units of the normal line height.
This function returns the default file permissions, as an integer.
This function returns the definition of key in keymap. All the other functions described in this chapter that look up keys use lookup-key. Here are examples:
This function returns the description string of property prop’s value, or nil if value has no description.
This function returns the desired size of xwidget as a list of the form (width height). The dimensions are in pixels.
This function returns the directory part of filename, as a directory name (see Directory Names), or nil if filename does not include a directory part.
This function returns the display-start position of window window. If window is nil, the selected window is used.
This function returns the documentation string of <var>face</var> as a face.
This function returns the documentation string of <var>function</var>. It handles macros, named keyboard macros, and special forms, as well as ordinary functions.
This function returns the documentation string of category <var>category</var> in category table <var>table</var>.
This function returns the documentation string of face face, or nil if none was specified for it.

This function returns the documentation string recorded in symbol’s property list under property property. It is most often used to look up the documentation strings of variables, for which property is variable-documentation. However, it can also be used to look up other kinds of documentation, such as for customization groups (but for function documentation, use the documentation function, below).
This function returns the duration of the Emacs initialization (see Startup Summary) in seconds, as a string. When called interactively, it prints the duration in the echo area.
This function returns the edges of window’s body (see Window Sizes). Calling (window-body-edges window) is equivalent to calling (window-edges window t), see above.

This function returns the editable contents of the minibuffer (that is, everything except the prompt) as a string, if a minibuffer is current. Otherwise, it returns the entire contents of the current buffer.
This function returns the effective

This function returns the element of sequence at the specified index, which is an integer whose valid value range is zero to one less than the length of sequence. For out-of-range values on built-in sequence types, seq-elt behaves like elt. For the details, see Definition of elt.

This function returns the element of sequence indexed by index. Legitimate values of index are integers ranging from 0 up to one less than the length of sequence. If sequence is a list, out-of-range values behave as for nth. See Definition of nth. Otherwise, out-of-range values trigger an args-out-of-range error.

This function returns the element of vector at index. The index of the first vector element is zero. The function raises the args-out-of-range error condition if the value of index is invalid. To extract C data from the value the function returns, use the other extraction functions described here, as appropriate for the Lisp data type stored in that element of the vector.
This function returns the end of the field specified by <var>pos</var>.
This function returns the entire property list of the character at position in the string or buffer object. If object is nil, it defaults to the current buffer.
This function returns the error message string for a given error descriptor. It is useful if you want to handle an error by printing the usual error message for that error. See Definition of signal.

This function returns the exit status of process or the signal number that killed it. (Use the result of process-status to determine which of those it is.) If process has not yet terminated, the value is 0. For network, serial, and pipe connections that are already closed, the value is either 0 or 256, depending on whether the connection was closed normally or abnormally.

This function returns the file name of the device used by terminal. If terminal is omitted or nil, it defaults to the selected frame’s terminal. terminal can also be a frame, meaning that frame’s terminal.
This function returns the file name to use for auto-saving the current buffer. This is just the file name with hash marks (‘
This function returns the filter function of <var>process</var>.
This function returns the finalizer of the user-ptr object represented by val, or NULL if it doesn’t have a finalizer.
This function returns the first n (an integer) elements of sequence. If n is negative or zero, the result is nil.

This function returns the first association for key in alist, comparing key against the alist elements using testfn if it is non-nil and equal otherwise (see Equality Predicates). It returns nil if no association in alist has a CAR equal to key. For example:
This function returns the first association with value value in alist. It returns nil if no association in alist has a CDReq to value.
This function returns the first association with value value in alist. It returns nil if no association in alist has a CDRequal to value.

This function returns the first buffer in the buffer list other than buffer. Usually, this is the buffer appearing in the most recently selected window (in frame frame or else the selected frame, see Input Focus), aside from buffer. Buffers whose names start with a space are not considered at all.

This function returns the first character in string. This mostly identical to (aref string 0), except that it returns 0 if the string is empty. (The value is also 0 when the first character of string is the null character,

This function returns the first child window of the internal window window—the topmost child window for a vertical combination, or the leftmost child window for a horizontal combination. If window is a live window, the return value is nil.
This function returns the first element in sequence for which predicate returns non-nil. If no element matches predicate, the function returns default.
This function returns the first non-nil value returned by applying predicate to each element of sequence in turn.

This function returns the first window displaying buffer-or-name in the cyclic ordering of windows, starting from the selected window (see Cyclic Window Ordering). If no such window exists, the return value is nil.

This function returns the fractional vertical position of a scroll bar event within the scroll bar. The value is a cons cell (portion . whole) containing two integers whose ratio is the fractional position.
This function returns the frame for which the window configuration <var>config</var> was made.
This function returns the frame that the window window belongs to. If window is nil, it defaults to the selected window.

This function returns the fringe bitmaps of the display line containing position pos in window window. The return value has the form (left right ov), where left is the symbol for the fringe bitmap in the left fringe (or nil if no bitmap), right is similar for the right fringe, and ov is non-nil if there is an overlay arrow in the left fringe.
This function returns the full name of the logged-in user—or the value of the environment variable NAME, if that is set.
This function returns the group name that corresponds to the numeric group ID gid, or nil if there is no such group.

This function returns the handler function for file name file, or nil if there is none. The argument operation should be the operation to be performed on the file—the value you will pass to the handler as its first argument when you call it. If operation equals inhibit-file-name-operation, or if it is not found in the operations property of the handler, this function returns nil.

This function returns the height in pixels for the font used by face in window. The specified window must be a live window. If nil or omitted, window defaults to the selected window, and face defaults to the default face in window.

This function returns the height in pixels of <var>window</var>’s header line. <var>window</var> must be a live window and defaults to the selected one. If <var>window</var> has no header line, the return value is zero.
This function returns the height in pixels of <var>window</var>’s header line. <var>window</var> must be a live window, and defaults to the selected window.
This function returns the height in pixels of <var>window</var>’s horizontal scrollbar.

This function returns the height in pixels of <var>window</var>’s mode line. <var>window</var> must be a live window and defaults to the selected one. If <var>window</var> has no mode line, the return value is zero.
This function returns the height in pixels of the font used by the current buffer’s default face, as that face is defined for the selected frame.
This function returns the height in pixels of the line at point in the selected window. The value includes the line spacing of the line (see Line Height).
This function returns the height of horizontal scroll bars of <var>frame</var> in pixels.

This function returns the height of text line line in window. If line is one of header-line or mode-line, window-line-height returns information about the corresponding line of the window. Otherwise, line is a text line number starting from 0. A negative number counts from the end of the window. The default for line is the current line in window; the default for window is the selected window.
This function returns the height of the screen in millimeters, or nil if Emacs cannot get that information.
This function returns the height of the screen in pixels. On a character terminal, it gives the height in characters.
This function returns the height, in lines, of the body of window window. If window is omitted or nil, it defaults to the selected window; otherwise it must be a live window.

This function returns the horizontal position of point, measured in columns, counting from 0 at the left margin. The column position is the sum of the widths of all the displayed representations of the characters between the start of the current line and point.

This function returns the indentation of the current line, which is the horizontal position of the first nonblank character. If the contents are entirely blank, then this is the horizontal position of the end of the line.
This function returns the index of the current frame number for <var>image</var>, counting from 0.

This function returns the index of the first element in sequence that is equal to elt. If the optional argument function is non-nil, it is a function of two arguments to use instead of the default equal.

This function returns the index of the start of the first match for the regular expression regexp in string, or nil if there is no match. If start is non-nil, the search starts at that index in string.
This function returns the integer remainder after division of <var>dividend</var> by <var>divisor</var>. The arguments must be integers or markers.

This function returns the interned symbol whose name is name. If there is no such symbol in the obarray obarray, intern creates a new one, adds it to the obarray, and returns it. If obarray is omitted, the value of the global variable obarray is used.
This function returns the key or mouse button that event describes, with all modifiers removed. The event argument is as in event-modifiers. For example:

This function returns the kind of nonlocal exit condition stored in env, like non_local_exit_check does, but it also returns the full information about the nonlocal exit, if any. If the return value is emacs_funcall_exit_signal, the function stores the error symbol in *symbol and the error data in *data (see Signaling Errors). If the return value is emacs_funcall_exit_throw, the function stores the catch tag symbol in *symbol and the throw value in *data. The function doesn’t store anything in memory pointed by these arguments when the return value is emacs_funcall_exit_return.
This function returns the kind of nonlocal exit condition stored in <var>env</var>. The possible values are:
This function returns the largest element of <var>sequence</var>. The elements of <var>sequence</var> must be numbers or markers.
This function returns the largest of its arguments.
This function returns the largest value that a valid character codepoint can have.
This function returns the last buffer in frame’s buffer list other than buffer. If frame is omitted or nil, it uses the selected frame’s buffer list.

This function returns the last error form recorded when a thread exited due to an error. Each thread that exits abnormally overwrites the form stored by the previous thread’s error with a new value, so only the last one can be accessed. If cleanup is non-nil, the stored form is reset to nil.

This function returns the last link of list. The car of this link is the list’s last element. If list is null, nil is returned. If n is non-nil, the nth-to-last link is returned instead, or the whole of list if n is bigger than list’s length.
This function returns the leftmost child window of window, if window is an internal window whose children form a horizontal combination. For any other type of window, the return value is nil.

This function returns the length of <var>list</var>, with no risk of either an error or an infinite loop. It generally returns the number of distinct cons cells in the list. However, for circular lists, the value is just an upper bound; it is often too large.
This function returns the length of object if it is a proper list, nil otherwise (see Cons Cells). In addition to satisfying listp, a proper list is neither circular nor dotted.

This function returns the line number in the current buffer corresponding to the buffer position pos. If pos is nil or omitted, the current buffer position is used. If absolute is nil, the default, counting starts at (point-min), so the value refers to the contents of the accessible portion of the (potentially narrowed) buffer. If absolute is non-nil, ignore any narrowing and return the absolute line number.

This function returns the list x with the last element, or the last n elements, removed. If n is greater than zero it makes a copy of the list so as not to damage the original list. In general, (append (butlast x n) (last x n)) will return a list equal to x.
This function returns the list of <var>symbol</var>’s active watcher functions.
This function returns the list of aliases of <var>coding-system</var>.

This function returns the list of all suffixes that load should try, in order, when its must-suffix argument is non-nil. This takes both load-suffixes and load-file-rep-suffixes into account. If load-suffixes, jka-compr-load-suffixes and load-file-rep-suffixes all have their standard values, this function returns (".elc" ".elc.gz" ".el" ".el.gz") if Auto Compression mode is enabled and (".elc" ".el") if Auto Compression mode is disabled.
This function returns the list of buffers recently re-shown in window via switch-to-prev-buffer. The window argument must denote a live window or nil (meaning the selected window).
This function returns the list of character sets (see Character Sets) supported by coding-system. Some coding systems that support too many character sets to list them all yield special values:
This function returns the list of coding systems in the order of their current priorities. Optional argument highestp, if non-nil, means return only the highest priority coding system.

This function returns the list of version numbers of the GUI window system running on <var>display</var>, such as the X server on GNU and Unix systems. The value is a list of three integers: the major and minor version numbers of the protocol, and the distributor-specific release number of the window system software itself. On GNU and Unix systems, these are normally the version of the X protocol and the distributor-specific release number of the X server software. On MS-Windows, this is the version of the Windows OS.
This function returns the live window at the coordinates x and y given in default character sizes (see Frame Font) relative to the native position of frame (see Frame Geometry).

This function returns the live window at the upper left corner of the frame specified by frame-or-window. The argument frame-or-window must denote a window or a live frame and defaults to the selected frame. If frame-or-window specifies a window, this function returns the first window on that window’s frame. Under the assumption that the frame from our canonical example is selected (frame-first-window) returns W2.
This function returns the logarithm of arg, with base base. If you don’t specify base, the natural base e is used. If arg or base is negative, log returns a NaN.
This function returns the longest common substring of all possible completions of <var>string</var> in <var>collection</var>.
